Event.name: Dispersal
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> or a <fen>Cause</fen> disperses or scatters <fen>Individuals</fen> from the <fen>Source</fen>,a relatively confined space, to a the <fen>Goal_area</fen>, a broader space.
<ex><fex name="Agent">She</fex> <t>scattered</t> <fex name="Individuals">his ashes</fex> <fex name="Goal_area">in the bay</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Source
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Source</fen> is the relatively confined space from which an <fen>Agent</fen> scatters the <fen>Individuals</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Goal_area
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Goal_area</fen> identifies the broader space to which the <fen>Agent</fen> scatters the <fen>Individuals</fen></def-root>

Arg.name: Cause
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An event or force that causes that <fen>Individuals</fen> to disperse.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root> Any description of the dispersing event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). With agentive uses, it may indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Agent</fen> that also affect the action (eagerly, carefully).
<ex> He <fex name="Manner">carefully</fex> <t>scattered</t> more mud around the rose bed</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>An intentional action performed by the <fen>Agent</fen> that accomplishes the dispersal.</def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition: <def-root>A state of the <fen>Individuals</fen> that results from the dispersal.</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root> A state of affairs that the <fen>Agent</fen> is responding to in dispersing the <fen>Individuals</fen></def-root>

Arg.name: Distance
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The distance that the <fen>Individuals</fen> move from their original location, the <fen>Source</fen>.
<ex>Firing four shots into the air <t>scattered</t> them <fex name="Distance">only a short distance</fex>, but it was enough.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Speed
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The rate of motion of the <fen>Individuals</fen>, usually in terms of how long it takes for them to leave the <fen>Source</fen> and end up in the <fen>Goal_area</fen>.
<ex>We <t>dispersed</t> the smoke <fex name="Speed">as rapidly as possible</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

lexUnit.name: disperse.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: go or distribute in different directions or over a wide area.

lexUnit.name: dissolve.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (with reference to a solid) become or cause to become incorporated into a liquid so as to form a solution

lexUnit.name: scatter.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: throw in various random directions.

lexUnit.name: dissolution.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action or process of dissolving or being dissolved.

lexUnit.name: dispersal.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the fact of distributing in different directions or over a wide area

lexUnit.name: dispersion.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action, process, or state of dispersing or being dispersed.

lexUnit.name: distribute.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: hand or share out to a number of recipients.

lexUnit.name: distribution.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the fact of handing or sharing out to a number of recipients.

lexUnit.name: spread.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: distribute a mass or a number of individuals over a surface

lexUnit.name: strew.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: scatter untidily over a surface or area

lexUnit.name: sprinkle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: scatter or pour (small drops or particles) over an object or surface.

lexUnit.name: pass on.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to transmit something (information, disease, etc) to another without loss of possession
